intro: Chuquiraga atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions through its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale green or yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Chuquiraga atacamensis is an important component of the local flora in the Atacama Desert ecosystem.
